curriculumStandard: New York State K-12 Social Studies Framework - Grade 9: Global History and Geography I
curriculumFocus: The Eastern Hemisphere from earliest civilizations to approximately 1750, including the development of civilizations, empires, religions, and global interactions

topics.name: Paleolithic Era and First Civilizations
topics.description: Beginning with the Paleolithic Era and development of the first human civilizations

media.title: The Story of Us: Origins
media.relevance: National Geographic series on human history; Episode 1 covers early civilizations
media.notes: Morgan Freeman narrates; excellent production quality

media.title: The Prince of Egypt
media.relevance: Animated epic depicting ancient Egypt and the Exodus story
media.notes: Beautiful animation; shows Egyptian architecture, society, and religious themes

media.title: Egypt: Engineering an Empire
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on ancient Egyptian engineering
media.notes: Covers pyramids, temples, and Egyptian achievements

media.title: Secrets of the Dead: Egypt's Darkest Hour
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the collapse of Egypt's Old Kingdom
media.notes: Archaeological investigation; shows climate change effects

media.title: The Mummy (1999)
media.relevance: Adventure film set in ancient Egypt
media.notes: Fiction but sparks interest in Egyptian history and archaeology

media.title: Ancient Mesopotamia: This History, Our History
media.relevance: Oriental Institute documentary on Mesopotamian civilizations
media.notes: Academic but accessible; covers Sumer, Babylon, Assyria

media.title: First Civilizations
media.relevance: PBS 4-part series exploring the world's first civilizations
media.notes: Covers cities, war, religion, and trade in early civilizations

media.title: Crash Course World History: Mesopotamia
media.relevance: Cradle of civilization overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] John Green; engaging overview

media.title: Crash Course World History: Ancient Egypt
media.relevance: Ancient Egypt civilization
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Pharaohs, pyramids, Nile

media.title: TED-Ed: How to Speak Egyptian
media.relevance: Hieroglyphics explained
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Fun language lesson

media.title: Crash Course World History: Alexander the Great
media.relevance: Alexander's conquests
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Hellenistic spread

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Roman Empire
media.relevance: Rise of Rome
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Republic to Empire

media.title: TED-Ed: What Romans Actually Ate for Dinner
media.relevance: Roman daily life
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Engaging daily life topic

media.title: Oversimplified: The Punic Wars
media.relevance: Rome vs Carthage
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Hannibal and Roman expansion

media.title: Crash Course World History: Buddha and Ashoka
media.relevance: Buddhism and Indian empires
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Indian history and religion

media.title: Crash Course World History: 2000 Years of Chinese History
media.relevance: Chinese dynastic history
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Mandates and dynasties

media.title: TED-Ed: The Rise and Fall of the Persian Empire
media.relevance: Persian Empire overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Cyrus to Alexander

topics.name: Ancient Greece and Rome
topics.description: Examination of classical Greek and Roman civilizations, their governments, cultures, and legacies

media.title: Horrible Histories: Groovy Greeks
media.relevance: British educational comedy covering Greek history with humor
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - engaging and funny while historically accurate

media.title: Horrible Histories: Rotten Romans
media.relevance: British educational comedy covering Roman history
media.notes: Makes Roman history accessible and memorable

media.title: Troy (2004)
media.relevance: Epic depicting the Trojan War based on Homer's Iliad
media.notes: R-rated for war violence; teacher reference; spectacular visuals of ancient world

media.title: Alexander (2004)
media.relevance: Epic about Alexander the Great's conquests
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; teacher reference on Alexander's empire

media.title: Ben-Hur (1959)
media.relevance: Epic set in Roman-occupied Judea; shows Roman society and chariot racing
media.notes: G-rated classic; long but excellent for showing Roman era; Academy Award winner

media.title: Spartacus (1960)
media.relevance: Classic epic about Roman slave revolt
media.notes: Kirk Douglas classic; shows slavery in Roman Empire

media.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire
media.relevance: History Channel 13-episode series on Roman history
media.notes: Comprehensive coverage; select episodes for specific topics

media.title: Engineering an Empire: Rome
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Roman engineering
media.notes: Covers aqueducts, roads, Colosseum

media.title: The Greeks
media.relevance: PBS/National Geographic 3-part documentary on Greek civilization
media.notes: Modern documentary covering Greek history comprehensively

media.title: Cleopatra (1963)
media.relevance: Epic depicting Cleopatra, Caesar, and Mark Antony
media.notes: G-rated; very long; Elizabeth Taylor; shows end of Roman Republic

media.title: Julius Caesar (1953)
media.relevance: Shakespeare adaptation with Marlon Brando as Mark Antony
media.notes: Classic adaptation; good for cross-curricular with English

topics.name: Persian Empire
topics.description: Study of the Persian Empire, its expansion, and conflicts with Greek city-states

media.relevance: Stylized depiction of Battle of Thermopylae
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; visually striking but historically problematic

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Persians
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Persian engineering achievements
media.notes: Covers Persepolis, Royal Road, and Persian innovations

media.title: The Persians: A History of Iran
media.relevance: Documentary series on Persian/Iranian history
media.notes: Comprehensive coverage of Persian civilization

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Mughal Empire
media.relevance: Mughal India
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Akbar, Taj Mahal

media.title: TED-Ed: The Taj Mahal: A Monument to Eternal Love
media.relevance: Taj Mahal history
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Mughal architecture

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Ottoman Empire
media.relevance: Ottoman overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Suleiman the Magnificent

media.title: Extra History: Suleiman the Magnificent
media.relevance: Ottoman golden age (4 parts)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Animated Ottoman history

media.title: Crash Course World History: Ming China
media.relevance: Ming Dynasty
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Forbidden City, exploration

media.title: History Matters: Why Did China Stop Exploring?
media.relevance: Ming isolation
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Quick explanation

media.title: Kings and Generals: Samurai, Daimyo, Matthew Perry, and Gunboat Diplomacy
media.relevance: Japan's isolation and opening
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Japanese history

topics.name: Ancient China and India
topics.description: Development of early Chinese dynasties and Indian civilizations including Buddhism and Hinduism
subtopics: Chinese dynasties - Shang, Zhou, Qin, Han

media.title: Mulan (1998)
media.relevance: Animated film set during the Han Dynasty, depicts Chinese culture
media.notes: Shows Chinese culture, military, family honor; Great Wall shown

media.title: Kung Fu Panda
media.relevance: Animated film showcasing Chinese culture, martial arts, and philosophy
media.notes: Not historical but excellent for Chinese cultural elements

media.title: China: A Century of Revolution
media.relevance: PBS documentary; first part covers imperial China
media.notes: Comprehensive; select early episodes for ancient history

media.title: The Story of China
media.relevance: BBC/PBS 6-part documentary covering 4,000 years of Chinese history
media.notes: Michael Wood presents; excellent for ancient dynasties

media.title: Secrets of the Dead: China's Terracotta Warriors
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the Terracotta Army of Qin Shi Huang
media.notes: Excellent for Qin Dynasty and first emperor

media.title: The Buddha
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the life of Buddha and spread of Buddhism
media.notes: Richard Gere narrates; covers origins of Buddhism in India

media.title: The Story of India
media.relevance: BBC/PBS 6-part documentary on Indian history
media.notes: Michael Wood; covers ancient India through modern era

media.title: Little Buddha
media.relevance: Bernardo Bertolucci film depicting Buddha's life story
media.notes: PG; Keanu Reeves as Siddhartha; beautiful visuals of Buddhist teachings

media.title: Hero (2002)
media.relevance: Visually stunning martial arts film set during Qin unification
media.notes: PG-13; shows Qin Dynasty; beautiful cinematography of ancient China

topics.name: Byzantine Empire
topics.description: Eastern Roman Empire, its culture, religion, and influence

media.title: Byzantium: The Lost Empire
media.relevance: John Romer documentary series on Byzantine history
media.notes: 4-part series covering Byzantine civilization comprehensively

media.title: Engineering an Empire: Byzantines
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Byzantine engineering
media.notes: Covers Hagia Sophia, walls of Constantinople

media.title: The Fall of Constantinople
media.relevance: Documentary on the 1453 Ottoman conquest
media.notes: Covers the end of Byzantine Empire

media.title: Crash Course World History: Islam
media.relevance: Origins and spread of Islam
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Respectful overview

media.title: TED-Ed: The Golden Age of Islam
media.relevance: Islamic Golden Age contributions
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Science, math, medicine

media.title: Crash Course World History: Mansa Musa and Mali
media.relevance: Mali Empire and African trade
media.notes: [Quick Clip] ESSENTIAL - West African history

media.title: TED-Ed: Mansa Musa, One of the Wealthiest People Who Ever Lived
media.relevance: Mansa Musa's wealth
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Mali's legendary ruler

media.title: Crash Course World History: Fall of the Roman Empire
media.relevance: Why Rome fell
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Transition to medieval

media.title: Extra History: Byzantine Empire
media.relevance: 5-part series on Byzantium
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Animated history; engaging

media.title: TED-Ed: The Silk Road: History's First World Wide Web
media.relevance: Silk Road trade overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Trade and cultural exchange

media.title: Crash Course World History: Venice and the Ottoman Empire
media.relevance: Trade and empires
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Mediterranean trade

media.title: Kings and Generals: Fall of Constantinople
media.relevance: 1453 Ottoman conquest
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Detailed military history

topics.name: Islamic Empires
topics.description: Rise and spread of Islam, development of Islamic civilizations and Golden Age
subtopics: Islamic Golden Age - science, math, medicine

media.title: The Message (1976)
media.relevance: Epic film about the origins of Islam; made with Muslim scholars' input
media.notes: PG; respectful portrayal; Muhammad not depicted (per Islamic tradition)

media.title: Islam: Empire of Faith
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the history of Islamic civilization
media.notes: 3-part series; Ben Kingsley narrates; covers Golden Age

media.title: Science and Islam
media.relevance: BBC documentary on Islamic contributions to science
media.notes: 3-part series on algebra, astronomy, medicine in Islamic Golden Age

media.title: Lost Secrets of the Quran
media.relevance: Documentary exploring early Islamic history
media.notes: Academic approach to early Islamic texts

topics.name: African Kingdoms
topics.description: Study of African empires including Ghana, Mali, and Songhai
subtopics: Ghana Empire - gold and salt trade

media.title: Africa's Great Civilizations
media.relevance: Henry Louis Gates Jr. PBS documentary on African history
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - 6 parts covering Ghana, Mali, Great Zimbabwe

media.title: Lost Kingdoms of Africa
media.relevance: BBC documentary series on pre-colonial African kingdoms
media.notes: 4-part series covering Ethiopia, Asante, Zimbabwe, Benin

media.title: Mansa Musa: The Richest Man Who Ever Lived
media.relevance: Documentary on Mali Empire's legendary ruler
media.notes: Covers Musa's famous pilgrimage and Mali's wealth

media.title: Black Panther
media.relevance: Fiction inspired by African cultures; shows advanced African civilization
media.notes: Fictional but celebrates African culture; good discussion starter

topics.name: Silk Road and Trans-Saharan Trade
topics.description: Expansion of trade networks connecting Asia, Africa, and Europe

media.title: The Silk Road
media.relevance: Classic NHK/CCTV documentary series retracing the Silk Road
media.notes: 12-part series; comprehensive coverage of the ancient route

media.title: Marco Polo (Netflix)
media.relevance: Netflix drama about Marco Polo at Kublai Khan's court
media.notes: TV-MA; NOT for classroom; shows Silk Road era

media.title: The Adventures of Marco Polo
media.relevance: Classic Hollywood film about Marco Polo's journey
media.notes: Old but accessible introduction to Polo's travels

media.title: Caravans: Indian Tales
media.relevance: Documentary on ancient Indian Ocean trade routes
media.notes: Covers maritime trade connections

topics.name: Feudalism and Medieval Society
topics.description: European feudal system, medieval life, and the role of the Catholic Church
subtopics: Feudal hierarchy - kings, lords, knights, serfs

media.title: Castle (David Macaulay)
media.relevance: Animated documentary on medieval castle construction
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - educational and engaging

media.title: The Crusades: Crescent & the Cross
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on the Crusades
media.notes: Presents both Christian and Muslim perspectives

media.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
media.relevance: Comedy satirizing medieval life and Arthurian legend
media.notes: PG; humorous but actually teaches about medieval society; some crude humor

media.title: A Knight's Tale
media.relevance: Depicts medieval tournaments and social hierarchy
media.notes: PG-13; anachronistic music but shows medieval social structure well

media.title: The Black Death: The World's Most Devastating Plague
media.relevance: Great Courses documentary on the Black Death
media.notes: Comprehensive; covers pandemic's social and economic effects

media.title: Terry Jones' Medieval Lives
media.relevance: BBC documentary examining medieval social roles
media.notes: 8 episodes on peasant, monk, knight, damsel, etc.

topics.name: Renaissance
topics.description: European Renaissance art, science, and humanism
subtopics: Renaissance art - da Vinci, Michelangelo, Raphael

media.title: The Agony and the Ecstasy
media.relevance: Classic film about Michelangelo painting the Sistine Chapel
media.notes: Charlton Heston as Michelangelo; shows Renaissance art and patronage

media.title: Leonardo: The Man Who Saved Science
media.relevance: PBS documentary on Leonardo da Vinci's contributions
media.notes: Covers da Vinci as artist, inventor, scientist

media.title: Ever After: A Cinderella Story
media.relevance: Set during Renaissance France; Leonardo da Vinci appears as character
media.notes: Shows Renaissance fashion, society; Drew Barrymore stars

media.title: Galileo's Battle for the Heavens
media.relevance: PBS NOVA documentary on Galileo and his conflict with the Church
media.notes: Covers Scientific Revolution and church-science conflicts

media.title: The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the Medici family's role in Renaissance
media.notes: 4-part series on art patronage and Renaissance Florence

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Renaissance
media.relevance: Renaissance overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Art, humanism, science

media.title: TED-Ed: The Chemistry of Cold War Colors
media.relevance: Renaissance color chemistry
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Renaissance art techniques

media.title: Crash Course World History: Luther and the Protestant Reformation
media.relevance: Reformation overview
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Martin Luther and 95 Theses

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Age of Exploration
media.relevance: European exploration era
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Columbus, Vasco da Gama

media.title: TED-Ed: How the Compass Unlocked the World
media.relevance: Navigation technology
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Exploration technology

media.title: Crash Course World History: The Columbian Exchange
media.relevance: Global exchange after 1492
media.notes: [Quick Clip] ESSENTIAL - plants, animals, disease

media.title: Extra History: Admiral Zheng He
media.relevance: Chinese exploration (4 parts)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Chinese exploration before Europeans

media.title: TED-Ed: The Atlantic Slave Trade
media.relevance: Slave trade context
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Important but sensitive topic

topics.name: Protestant Reformation
topics.description: Religious reformation and its global impact

media.title: Luther
media.relevance: Biographical film on Martin Luther
media.notes: Joseph Fiennes as Luther; comprehensive look at Reformation

media.title: Martin Luther: The Idea that Changed the World
media.relevance: Documentary for 500th anniversary of Reformation
media.notes: Hugh Bonneville narrates; accessible introduction

media.title: A Man for All Seasons
media.relevance: Academy Award winner about Thomas More during English Reformation
media.notes: G-rated; excellent for discussing conscience and religious conflict

topics.name: European Exploration
topics.description: Motivations for exploration, Age of Discovery, and encounters with the Americas

media.title: 1492: Conquest of Paradise
media.relevance: Epic depicting Columbus's voyages
media.notes: PG-13; Ridley Scott film; select scenes for classroom

media.title: Conquistadors
media.relevance: BBC/PBS documentary retracing conquistador routes
media.notes: Michael Wood; 4 parts covering Corts, Pizarro, Orellana, Cabeza de Vaca

media.title: The Age of Exploration
media.relevance: Documentary covering European exploration era
media.notes: Covers motivations and consequences of exploration

topics.name: Columbian Exchange
topics.description: Exchange of goods, diseases, ideas, and people between hemispheres

media.title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
media.relevance: PBS documentary based on Jared Diamond's book on civilization development
media.notes: 3-part series; covers Columbian Exchange effects

media.title: 1491: Before Columbus
media.relevance: Documentary on Americas before European contact
media.notes: Shows pre-contact civilizations and exchange aftermath

topics.name: Ottoman Empire
topics.description: Rise and expansion of the Ottoman Empire

media.title: Rise of Empires: Ottoman
media.relevance: Netflix docudrama on the fall of Constantinople
media.notes: TV-MA; NOT for classroom; excellent visuals of Ottoman conquest

media.title: Islam: Empire of Faith - The Ottomans
media.relevance: PBS episode covering Ottoman Empire
media.notes: Part of larger series; covers Ottoman culture and expansion

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Ottomans
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Ottoman engineering
media.notes: Covers Istanbul's architecture and engineering achievements

topics.name: Mughal Empire
topics.description: Mughal dynasty in India, its culture, architecture, and religious tolerance

media.title: Jodhaa Akbar
media.relevance: Bollywood epic about Akbar and his Hindu wife
media.notes: Very long; beautiful visuals; shows religious tolerance under Akbar

media.title: The Story of India: Ages of Gold
media.relevance: PBS episode covering Mughal Empire
media.notes: Michael Wood; covers Mughal golden age

media.title: Secrets of the Taj Mahal
media.relevance: Documentary on the construction of the Taj Mahal
media.notes: Explores architecture and love story behind the monument

topics.name: Ming and Qing Dynasties
topics.description: Chinese dynasties, their achievements, and interactions with European traders

media.title: The Story of China: The Ming
media.relevance: PBS episode on Ming Dynasty
media.notes: Covers Forbidden City, Zheng He, and Ming achievements

media.title: The Last Emperor
media.relevance: Academy Award winner about China's last emperor Puyi
media.notes: PG-13; later period but shows Forbidden City beautifully

media.title: China: Forbidden City
media.relevance: Documentary exploring the Forbidden City
media.notes: Explores architecture and imperial Chinese life

media.title: 1421: The Year China Discovered the World
media.relevance: Documentary on Zheng He's voyages (controversial thesis)
media.notes: Claims disputed but good for discussing Chinese exploration

topics.name: Safavid Empire
topics.description: Persian Safavid Empire and Shia Islam

media.title: Iran: A History of Its Architecture
media.relevance: Documentary covering Persian architectural heritage
media.notes: Covers Safavid Isfahan and Persian artistic achievements

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Persians
media.relevance: Includes section on Safavid Persia
media.notes: Covers Persian engineering from ancient to Safavid era

topics.name: Aztec and Inca Empires
topics.description: Complex societies in Mesoamerica and South America before Spanish conquest

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Aztecs
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Aztec engineering
media.notes: Covers Tenochtitlan and Aztec achievements

media.title: Engineering an Empire: The Inca
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Incan engineering
media.notes: Covers Machu Picchu and Incan roads

media.title: The Road to El Dorado
media.relevance: Animated adventure in Mesoamerican-inspired setting
media.notes: Fictional but excellent visual introduction

media.title: Conquistadors: The Fall of the Aztec Empire
media.relevance: PBS documentary on Spanish conquest of the Aztecs
media.notes: Michael Wood; covers Corts and fall of Tenochtitlan
